column4: hey all.  anyone good with NFS?   I am having some speed issues mounting NFS shares over 100MB network.  it takes over 3 minutes mount a share.  they mount and work ok.  but it never used to take this long.
I just ran into the same problem today.  Are you mounting a big export?
one is 120GB.  the other one is 40.
i recently upgraded the client side to feisty.  the server is still edgy
hmmm.  Well, I had the exact same setup in Fedora5 (on server and client) and today when I finally set it up again (dapper server and edgy client) it's slow as hell.
yeah.  its odd.  It was wicked fast before with edgy edgy.
I also notice real slow ssh logins at first too.  Takes forever after taking the password.  But now it's ok.
ssh is fine here.
wick fast?  Are you up here in the NE with me?
canada west
I didn't know they said wicked out there too.  Us Mainahs get made fun of for it.
funny.
i wonder if problem is feisty based for me..
I don't know.  Like I said, dapper server and edgy client are slow here on mounting.  After that I'm ok, but mounting takes forever.
before it was like mounting a drive in the machine.  hmmm maybe my exports file is buggared
I'm not used to this weird exports (UUID blahblah) file.  I wonder if they have anything to do with it.
I didnt use UUID
I didnt use UUID's  i think thats the new fstabs
well, I've never seen them before today.  When I went into exports I said "wtf is this" and then found out that you don't have to have that line
i am gonna take another look.
yeah man.   I dont see any UUID stuff in my exports
